                                                                               â€“3â€“                                                                8823 â€“ 6514M


Subject Details: Physics HL Paper 2 Markscheme

Candidates are required to answer all questions. Maximum total = 90 marks.

1.    Each row in the â€œQuestionâ€ column relates to the smallest subpart of the question.

2.    The maximum mark for each question subpart is indicated in the â€œTotalâ€ column.

3.    Each marking point in the â€œAnswersâ€ column is shown by means of a tick (âœ”) at the end of the marking point.

4.    A question subpart may have more marking points than the total allows. This will be indicated by â€œmaxâ€ written after the mark in the â€œTotalâ€ column.
      The related rubric, if necessary, will be outlined in the â€œNotesâ€ column.

5.    An alternative wording is indicated in the â€œAnswersâ€ column by a slash (/). Either wording can be accepted.

6.    An alternative answer is indicated in the â€œAnswersâ€ column by â€œORâ€. Either answer can be accepted.

7.    An alternative markscheme is indicated in the â€œAnswersâ€ column under heading ALTERNATIVE 1 etc. Either alternative can be accepted.

8.    Words inside chevrons Â« Â» in the â€œAnswersâ€ column are not necessary to gain the mark.

9.    Words that are underlined are essential for the mark.

10.   The order of marking points does not have to be as in the â€œAnswersâ€ column, unless stated otherwise in the â€œNotesâ€ column.

11.   If the candidateâ€™s answer has the same â€œmeaningâ€ or can be clearly interpreted as being of equivalent significance, detail and validity as that in the
      â€œAnswersâ€ column then award the mark. Where this point is considered to be particularly relevant in a question it is emphasized by OWTTE
      (or words to that effect) in the â€œNotesâ€ column.

12.   Remember that many candidates are writing in a second language. Effective communication is more important than grammatical accuracy.

13.   Occasionally, a part of a question may require an answer that is required for subsequent marking points. If an error is made in the first marking point
      then it should be penalized. However, if the incorrect answer is used correctly in subsequent marking points then follow through marks should
      be awarded. When marking, indicate this by adding ECF (error carried forward) on the script. â€œECF acceptableâ€ will be displayed in the â€œNotesâ€ column.

14.   Do not penalize candidates for errors in units or significant figures, unless it is specifically referred to in the â€œNotesâ€ column.

                  the engine/probe exerts a force on the fuel molecules/gas âœ”                              speed not just a change in

                  <<by NIII>> an equal and opposite force acts on the engine/probe âœ”                                                           3

                  ALTERNATIVE 3
                  engine causes change in momentum to fuel molecules/gas âœ”
                   Â« by conservation of momentum Â» the probe has an equal and opposite change in
                  momentum âœ”
                  this results in deceleration/reduction in speed âœ”

6.     d    ii   ALTERNATIVE 1
                 when A is positive and B negative bottom right diode and top left diodes
                 conduct making X positive and Y negativeâœ”
                 when A is negative and B positive top right and bottom left diodes
                 conduct making X positive and Y negative âœ”
                 whatever polarity of supply, X is always positive and Y negative Â«so
                 charge can only flow in one directionÂ» âœ”                                                                                  3

                 ALTERNATIVE 2
                 A diode only conducts/allows a flow of charge in one direction âœ”
                 During one half cycle one pair of diodes conduct <<and in the other half
                 cycle the other pair conducts>> âœ”
                 Current is always X to Y âœ”
